resources.string: Take a look at our list of smoothies below!

Need help eating healthy and getting all the nutrients you\'re looking for? With Berry Good Smoothies you not only get a great tasting smoothie but a nutritious one! All you have to do is let us know which nutrient you\'re looking for and we will do the rest. To get started, please click the start button below.
Please choose the nutrient you\'re looking for below and we will see what we can come up with!

• 1 frozen banana cut in chunks

 • 1 medium sweet apple washed with peel on

 • ¼ cup unsweetened almond milk

 • ¼ cup rolled oats

 • ½ cup chopped frozen banana about ½ of a large banana or 8, ¾-inch slices

 • 1 tablespoon peanut butter or almond butter

 • ½ tablespoon pure maple syrup plus additional to taste

 • 1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract

 • ¼ teaspoon ground cinnamon plus additional for serving

 • Pinch ground nutmeg

 • Pinch ground allspice

 • Small handful ice
How can you say no to banana?

• 1 banana

 • ½ orange, peeled and quartered

 • ⅓ cup Greek yogurt

 • ¼ cup water or milk (dairy or non-dairy)

 • 1 to 2 teaspoons honey, optional
Delicious and good for the eyes!

• 1 cup chopped carrots steamed and cooled if you do not have a high-power blender or to make extra smooth for kids

• ½ cup frozen sliced banana

 • ½ cup plain Greek yogurt

 • ½ cup unsweetened vanilla cashew milk unsweetened vanilla almond milk, or milk of your choice

 • ¼ cup frozen diced pineapple

 • 2 tablespoons toasted walnuts

 • 1 tablespoon flaked coconut optional

 • ¼ teaspoon cinnamon

 • Pinch nutmeg

 • shredded carrots, coconut, crushed walnuts for topping
Not only healthy but tasty too!

• 1 ½ cups unsweetened almond milk

 • 2 cups spinach* frozen

 • 1 medium banana frozen

 • 1 cup fruit of choice**

 • Optional add ins: protein powder bee pollen, collagen, etc.

• 2 fresh mangoes or 2 cups of frozen mango

 • 1 small frozen banana (or half of a large banana), you can use unfrozen if using frozen mango

 • ½ cup milk, dairy or dairy-free

 • ½ cup yogurt, dairy or dairy-free

• 1 medium ripe banana, sliced

 • 1 medium pear, seeded and diced

 • 2/3 cup almond milk

 • 2 to 4 slices fresh peeled ginger, or to taste

 • 2 tablespoons honey

 • ½ teaspoon pure vanilla extract

 • ¼ teaspoon ground cinnamon, or to taste

 • 1 ½ cups coarsely chopped kale

 • 1 cup ice

• 1 cup low fat milk (or juice)

 • ½ cup strawberry Greek yogurt

 • 1 frozen banana cut in chunks

 • 1 ½ cups fresh or frozen strawberries

1 banana sliced and frozen

 • ½ cup plain Greek yogurt 130 g, or dairy-free alternative

 • ¼ cup key or regular lime juice 60 mL

 • 1 Tbsp honey 15 mL, or sweetener of choice

 • ½ tsp finely grated lime zest

 • ¼ tsp vanilla extract 1.2 mL

 • Optional for texture: ice

 • Optional for color: spinach

 • Optional garnish: graham cracker crumbs, lime wedge

The image you see at the top of most screens is an image created by Chris Green using Adobe photoshop and Adobe Illustrator.
The background image was created by Chris Green using Adobe Photoshop and Adobe Illustrator.
The bubble background was created and designed by Chris Green in Adobe Photoshop and Adobe Illustrator.
Launcher icon created by Chris Green in Adobe Photoshop and Adobe Illustrator

Looks like we don\'t have any smoothies that match.
